definition: (of spiders, caterpillars, silkworms etc) to extrude silk
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist with his own petard

sentences.english: The matured larvae pupate on the back of leaves.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫在叶背吐丝结稀疏的薄茧化蛹。

sentences.english: Spring maize grain starch content changed as a single peak curve after silking.
sentences.chinese: 春玉米籽粒淀粉组分吐丝后呈单峰曲线变化。

sentences.english: Though they had eight legs, trigonotarbids lacked spinnerets and so, presumably, could not produce silk.
sentences.chinese: 据此推测，它们或许也没有吐丝能力。

sentences.english: In spring, they spin their cocoons.
sentences.chinese: 到了春天，它们才吐丝结茧。

sentences.english: In addition, 1000-grain weight also increased by spraying BR after corn silk.
sentences.chinese: 另外，吐丝后喷施BR亦有增加千粒重的效果。

sentences.english: This reduces the risk of missing pollen shed during the receptive silking period.
sentences.chinese: 这就降低了风险失踪花粉大棚在接受吐丝期。

sentences.english: The main qualitative indices were for high population photosynthesis at silking stage.
sentences.chinese: 玉米吐丝期群体高光效的主要质量指标。

sentences.english: First, they are the only adult ants known to produce silk.
sentences.chinese: 首先，它们是已知的成年蚁中唯一为吐丝的。

sentences.english: Silk production is a key part in a spiders' life.
sentences.chinese: 吐丝是蜘蛛一生中的关键部分。

sentences.english: Many tiny tubes connect each silk gland with a spinneret.
sentences.chinese: 许多极细小的导管把每个造丝腺体与吐丝器相连。

sentences.english: “But if you look at a silkworm, it only has one kind of spinneret,” she added.
sentences.chinese: “但桑蚕只有一种吐丝器，”她补充说。

definition: to pupate/to turn into a chrysalis
Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
imago (adult, sexually mature insect, the final stage of its development)
